page.title: 05SHOPPING CENTRE,EDINBURGH
page.content: The building company Gilbert Ash thought of the idea of a Shopping Centre at Cameron Toll.More commonly known as the Savacentre,it was opened on 2 October 1984.It covers 26 acres and cost Â£32.5 millions. It took 2years 1month to build. It employs 1200 people,250 of whom are part timers. The Centre has 45 shops,the most popular being the SAVACENTRE and the least used the optician. Other facilities include a restuarant and a car park which holds 1000 cars.So a family can do a week's shopping in a compact covered are,have a meal, and fill the car with petrol.It is also on several bus routes. The main centre is open 7 days a week,from 9 until 8,except Sundays from 9 till 5. The Centre won an award for the best centre opened in Europe in 1984. It was competing against 24 others.
